title: Increase the number of bans
body: When LOL first game to be and introduced the bans system they only allowed 3 champs to be banned per team. I'm just thinking that this should be updated. A total of 6 bans for 40-50 champs, ok thats pretty fair. Yet we have 127 champions now and only have a total of 6 bans still? i feel like this causes teams to only pick the same comps and champs over and over because if they do not pick/ban them, then the other team will just use them. Makes the game a bit stale when its the same kind of god tier picks being fought over. I say we increase the number of bans per game. They clearly were ok with having a higher ratio of 40/6 but now how about for the 127 champs we have like 10 bans, or even 8 would help. just my thoughts, im sure this has been brought up before. Thank you for your time!

replies.body: If each player gets to ban one champ that is 10 bans in total. To me that is fair. Each player can ban who they don't want to go up against in their role based on who they are going to play. The way I see it that just means there are 117 champs to choose from. Still a lot to choose from and still be able to make counter play. I think that would be a great update.

Ohhhh one ban per player. I feel that would be a great update to have! Now players wouldn't have to gripe about one selfish first pick only banning counter to their incredibly  risky picks. Or that whole " i want mid, you want mid, best to ban your mid laner" sort of deal. I think thats a great tweak on my though, keep the ideas coming!  I have heard a lot of great feedback from everyone and so far the idea for implementing a new ban system is being supported by the majority. A great change! Even the though of possible banning out some champs on normal 3v3's would be another good thing. why not have draft pick on 3's when you have it on summoners rift? Seems only fair to implement another option to make everyone happy!
yeah that would be great for 3v3's  maybe allow the top pick player have two bans and the bottom player can make his two choices. idk. just one particular detail I thought.
Also that one guy who also dies to a certain pick and goes "Who forgot to ban [insert champion here]?" I definitely like this idea!

What would increasing the bans achieve? Because if the best 6 champions are banned each game, then the priority goes to the next 6-16. If you ban the 10 best champions each game, the priority goes to 10-20. 

Because lets be real - people are just permabanning the same champions. In the past week, Darius has a 93% banrate but has the 13th lowest win ratio at 46% (according to na.op.gg).

That's true, but look at it from different perspective:

Once Players will ban more of top-tier champions you should see more variety. Why? Cause top-tier just so happen to be good at many things at once often denying any usefullnes "weaker" champions have. With them gone you might see new champions

Not really. All that will happen is a rotation. All the 'B' Tier champions will be picked instead of the 'A' Tier ones. And once those got nerfed and adjusted, then the former 'A' tier champions will be able to rise back up. And so on unto infinitum. Theres literally no way to stop two sets of champions being played.

I disagree. Once you get to the "B" Tier champs, you get into the territory of strengths and weaknesses. You'll have players picking champions that match their play style instead of picking the Jack of all Trades. The 10-20 priority and beyond aren't good at everything. You'd see a lot more variety in my opinion. There will always be "powerful" champions, but increasing the ban limit would help the game. Even if its only and extra ban per team.

Now, and I'm just saying, did you ever think that Darius' win ratio is 46% not because he's not strong, but because when a team sees he isn't banned, someone goes "hey Darius isn't banned I'll play him!" when they really can't? Because this scenario happens a LOT.

I assume that when a team sees he isnt banned, the chance for someone good at Darius to go "hey Darius isnt banned, Ill play him" vs someone bad saying it reflects the percentage of good Darius's and bad Darius's in the population. So I assume that the 46% winrate would be the average winrate of the champion, regardless of the number of bans. For example, when Leblanc was permabanned, people stated that she had a low winrate (around 47%, i believe) and didnt deserve the ban - and people gave that same argument trying to explain away her low winrate. Now other threats are banned and Leblanc has a 46% winratio. 

Darius has 4.53% pick rate. That is over 26,000 games in the past week. Its not a small sample by any means.
Fair enough. Thank you for at least explaining your reasoning behind your position, I appreciate it ^^
You guys are _still_ permabanning Darius, so no, we don't need more bans.
I don't understand why people are scared of Darius

I'm still waiting for the time they let every team member have a ban instead of giving all the power to the one prick who drew the big straw...
4 or 5 bans per team does seem reasonable.  It would also be nice to see bans available in other modes, such as ARAM.

In case you don't know what ARAM stands for:

All Random All mid

We already have Reroll system. We don't need a second anti-random mechanic in ALL RANDOM game, really.

ARAM isn't completely random cause Riot doesn't want it to be.
That should not be an excuse to decrease randomness even more.

Btw, I have about 2k games played on ARAM ;)

Don't care how many games you've played on ARAM.  The number of games I've played was a context for knowing what ARAM is.  I didn't doubt you, so there was no need for you to provide something like this (other than to brag or boost your ego).

To mitigate those gaming the system with ARAM only accounts (thus already removing almost all of the randomness factor), yes bans need to be implemented.

If you want bans in ARAM then you definitely don't know what ARAM is.

Yea i love to boost my ego, I'm whole silver 2 and can easily penta whole challenger team.

Your response is completely illogical.  Having played hundreds of ARAM games, I definitely know what it is.  Differing opinions on a game mode do appear and this does not mean that the individual knows/does not know the mode in question.  You state that it truly isn't random (as have I).  ARAM only accounts go directly around and remove almost all randomness with the current setup.

You haven't provided any solutions, but only state you don't like bans.  What would you do differently to make it even more random?  Why is your solution something that would improve ARAM?

If bans for ARAM were to happen, then are you concerned that champs you use on ARAM would be banned a lot? Do you see ARAM only accounts as a problem?
Except when it rerolls, you get another champion chosen at random. Please tell me how that's an anti-random mechanic because I'm pretty sure you can't.

Reroll allows you to get something else than what you currently have. In other words by rerolling you change what you randomly got for a reason such as disliking a champion/being bad with him etc.

When you can choose to change a champion for other random one then where's "random" in 1st place?

I have hard time explaining it, really. But there is logic behind it.

I can see where you're going with it. And while I can somewhat agree, I still disagree with it. Yeah, you're getting a chance to change the original random champion you got, it's still for another random champion. 

But after giving it some thought, I guess you can argue that it's not _really_ random in the first place because you have to factor in the other 9 champions picked + which champions you don't own. Therefore unless you own all 127 champions like I do and only own 20 like I know some other people do, ignoring the definition of "random", is is truly random?

The world may never knowwwwww

Spend time learning to play against new champions instead of requesting more bans.  Bans are for very specific cases where a specific player is very good with a champion or the champion is OP (few and far between).  More bans are not needed.  Better players are needed.

We need less toxic players, so the non-toxic ones can rise out of the muck.  A ratio of bans to number of champions makes a lot of sense.  Most people are casual players and will not learn to play against most champions.  That aside, how many people do you think learn every champion in this game and their counters (not counting Pros)?
